TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit TimeoutException extends System.SystemException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the time allotted for a process or operation has expired.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about setting the time-out interval before a <xref:System.TimeoutException> exception is thrown, consult the documentation for the type whose method timed out. For information about handling the time-out, see the documentation for the method that threw the exception.
<xref:System.TimeoutException> uses the HRESULT, COR_E_TIMEOUT, which has the value 0x80131505.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.TimeoutException>, see the <xref:System.TimeoutException.%23ctor%2A> constructors.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of <xref:System.TimeoutException> in conjunction with members of the <xref:System.IO.Ports.SerialPort?displayProperty=fullName> class.
[!code-cpp[TimeoutException.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/TimeoutException.class/cpp/to.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[TimeoutException.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/TimeoutException.class/CS/to.cs#1)] [!code-vb[TimeoutException.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/TimeoutException.class/VB/to.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the inherited <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the new instance with a system-supplied error message. This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.TimeoutException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the inherited <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the new instance using the value of the `message` parameter.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.TimeoutException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|A null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that contains serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The object that contains contextual information about the source or destination. The context parameter is reserved for future use, and can be specified as .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [Binary Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/binary-serialization.md).

Docs.exception: The class name is , or is zero (0).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The message that describes the error.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the innerException parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified error message and inner exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the inherited <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the new instance using the value of the `message` parameter.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed to the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.TimeoutException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.|
